review.body:
Great story

I was quickly caught up in the atmosphere of this story and wanted to keep reading until it was finished. The tense it is written in seemed unusual but possibly that contributed to the drama. I enjoyed the juxtaposition of past and present, and the ideas around the interconnectedness o...

Very good book

Great edge of your seat reading. Very well written. Also very informative as to the ploys of politics. I could not put it down.
Bloody brilliant! Perfect short read - sweet, sexy, hilarious - perfect rom com! I thoroughly recommend
I was a bit confused at the beginning, but I ended up getting into it.

book.title: One Piece, Volume 01: Romance Dawn (One Piece, #1)

review.body: As an aspiring storyteller, animator, and cartoonist I have nothing but respect for One Piece.

4.5 stars



I loved this book, however it was very very very sad. which I heard about before picking this book up but it did break my heart. I enjoyed it up until the ending.
This book only has one word throughout the entire book, ball. It is about a dog who wants different members of the family to play ball with it, and portrays what goes on in a dogs mind.

Splendidly captivating! I couldn't stop reading; I just wanted it to go on and on and on. I really enjoyed the two story lines switching between the past and present. The plot is excellent and maintains a solid detective with a highly intelligent and intricate plot. The authors have tempered that...

book.title: The Chris Farley Show: A Biography in Three Acts

review.body:
Awesome



The best to ever do it!
Sad look into a comedic geniuses whirlwind of a life and career.
RIP Chris

2.5 to 3 stars

Way too many typos in the Kindle edition, which prevented me from losing myself in the book. Hopefully the print edition doesn't have the same problem.

book.title: Survival Quest (The Way of the Shaman, #1)

review.body: Good Translation, Excellent Story telling. most enjoyable.

book.title: Not Funny Ha-Ha: A Handbook for Something Hard

review.body: I wanted to like this book, but it reminded me of those condescending books written for children that talk about bullying or drugs. It had some good information, but it was too simplistic, and the situations they described were too neat, and too perfect.
Liked the text, illustrations not my favorite.

book.title: Morris Micklewhite and the Tangerine Dress

review.body: Build your own rocket ship!

Batter Up, yum

Loved this!! Worth 5 stars and than some!! Feel good easy read. Loved the characters as well. OK, Michael & Caitlyn, not so much, with good reason.

To see this on stage is now a new goal of mine. A perfect read that can sum up that feeling in life where you wonder are you proud of what you achieved and has it brought you happiness. As someone who once did door to door marketing, failing, dreaming, and hoping - I can empathize with this novel...

book.title: Breath: A Lifetime in the Rhythm of an Iron Lung: A Memoir

review.body: Such an inspirational story about a lady named Martha Mason who spent most of her life in an iron lung because of polio. Her family and community offered amazing support. Extremely well written.

An all-round fabulous read with beautifully rounded characters, a distressing but perfectly pitched back-story, and a brilliantly crafted plot that keeps you guessing to the eminently satisfying conclusion. I became so infatuated with this page-turner that the characters even penetrated my dreams...

Just days after marrying Sheriff Paul Davidson, Anna Pigeon moves to Colorado to assume her new post as district ranger at Rocky Mountain National Park. When two of three children who’d gone missing from a religious retreat reappear, Anna’s investigation brings her face-to-face with a paranoid se...

book.title: The Ultimate Guide to Nonprofit Fundraising with Crowdfunding: A start-to-finish handbook on how to raise money with crowdfunding (Crowdfunding, Nonprofit ... How to Raise Money, How to Crowdfund)

review.body:
Short and Sweet

I was interested in the topic for my business as well as a nonprofit in which I am involved. I found this informative and succinct. Just what I needed.
